properties.text: This is a guidebook covering a few select features and aspects of this modpack. Topics are divided into sections and subsections, with links to and from this page for rapid navigation.
You could also page through the whole book with these buttons!

At it's core, this is a modpack about building a factory, in a hostile world, protecting it, and using it to get rich.

An emphasis has been placed on encouraging the player to build big, and think about how the things in their base relate to one another, and on logistics tools that require you to think about what the space between points A and B are going to look like.

A need for base defense measures plays into this. Enemies will attempt to dig, build, or blast their way into your base. Setting up chokepoints, building walls of sturdy materials, and later, using turrets and other traps to defend your outpost, all will encourage and reward thoughtful building.

Various adjustments to vanilla gameplay to increase the combat difficulty mean that the pressure the world is putting on you actually means something, and that a stack of steaks isn't the only thing you need to be safe.

Rewards for mass production are implemented to make the factory you build "mean something", giving you goals to stretch toward.
Health regeneration has been sharply slowed, to give relevance to the variety of healing items provided by Minecraft and Mods.
Mobs will slowly ramp up in difficulty over time, and as you kill them. Dying resets this difficulty counter.

Playing on Easy will cause hostile AI to ignore the player, thanks to the "Apathetic Mobs" mod. For the player who wants to factory build without all the bother.

Further, most monster-derived items can be produced from Peaceful Mode compatible sources, if you'd rather not even see enemies.
Mobs are aggressive and Dangerous! They will dig and build to get at you, and vandalize your stuff if it's left unguarded!
Every 3rd night is a Blood Moon, and can't be skipped by sleeping!
Items dropped by slain players take 100 literal actual earth years to despawn. While they're not safe in a grave stone, you have plenty of time.
There are rewards for mixing up your diet a bit! The less often you've eaten a food, the more it fills you up!
Caves are absolutely enormous. They seem to go on forever, winding and looping back, absolutely perforating the world. Beware of monsters.
Ore Stratification has been stretched upward toward the surface, in an effort to make caving more lucrative than strip mining.
Hardcore Darkness is real! While places that can see the sky have minimal lighting at night, the same cannot be said for the underground.
Water is finite everywhere except for Swamp, River, Beach, and Ocean type biomes. Collect rain, pump it up from below bedrock, or, set up a shipping system from one of those. Or just move there.
Trying to handle exceedingly hot or cold fluids without protective mitts will have negative effects! Be wary of Lava, Molten Metals, Liquid Nitrogen, Cryotheum, and others!

In the tooltips of a number of items, you may have noticed lines reading "tagged:" followed by a tag name. These tool tip tags have been added to make searching for broad categories of items easier, and there are a number of them. While they are somewhat self-explanatory, they will be catalogued here.

#storeItem: Items which store items.

#storeFluid: Items which store fluids.

#storePower: Items which store power.

#moveItem: Blocks that transport items.

#movePower: Blocks for transmitting 
     FE.

#moveFluid: Blocks which move fluids.

#itemBag: Items which give the player 
          portable storage space.

#redstoneReact: Blocks that respond
     when given a redstone signal.

#redstoneTransmit: Blocks that push 
     out or convey a redstone signal.

#makePower: Machines and Blocks that 
     generate FE.

#worldInteract: Blocks that do stuff to
     the world, whether it be  place or 
     break blocks, spit out items, or
     other things.

#fortified: Blocks which have raised
     blast resistance and hardness, to
     keep digging mobs out.

#lighting: Blocks which shed light.

#explosive: Blocks and items which
     provide explosions

#mobility: Items and blocks that aid in
     traversal in the world. Flight,
     jumping boosts, and so on.

#navigation: Items that assist in       
     finding things and finding your
     way around the world.

#healing: Items and blocks related to 
     the healing of health and curing 
     of effects.

#keyBinds: These items have keybinds
     in the controls menu! If you want 
     to fully utilize them, check it out!

#construction: These items are 
     designed to aid in the building of
     larger structures with greater 
     ease than merely placing blocks
     one at a time.
Exclusive rewards await the industrious! Several tools exist for an enterprising tycoon to amass wealth, and spend it, gaining access to conveniences, tools, and toys in exchange for a nominal fee.

The Shop and Seller blocks allow you to sell a selection of machines and products in exchange for credit in your bank account. Typically, objects with rarer materials and more processing/crafting steps are worth more.

The Shop block will buy items from you when you click on the Item's icon in the "Sell" interface, removing it from your inventory and crediting your account.

The Seller block will immediately and automatically sell any items pumped into it via Conveyors, Hoppers, or similar. It's great for fully automatic profits!
The Bounty Board can be used to make more money from your goods. It randomly populates with timed rush orders that you can fulfill.

For the purposes of exchanging currency with other players, several items can act as stand-ins. Bills of varying denominations can be sold/bought 1:1 at the shop block.

The ATM block lets you withdraw from your account onto a bank card. Rightclicking with a bank card immediately absorbs its funds into your account.
Further, the "Trade" mod adds a "Trade" keybind for interacting directly with other players, allowing for bargaining and bartering currency and items.
The "Vending Block" mod adds a number of vending machines that are secure from other players mucking with, and that can be used to post up items for sale while you're not present.

All this talk of money, is well and good, but without something to spend it on, it's all just hot air, right? Luckily, the "Admin Shop" Shop is stocked with a bevy of unique and lucrative rewards of various functions. There might well be something for everyone here! Pictured to the right is just a small sample of its stock!
While in a typical Minecraft world, you would want to keep explosions away from your ores, this strange world plays by different rules.

When broken by an explosion, most ores will drop a "Shattered Ore", and then, 50% of the time, will drop an additional "Shattered Ore". These Shattered Ores are functionally the same as ore blocks for processing purposes, meaning that mining with explosives, if you're careful, can yeild much more ore than merely breaking the ores with a tool.

Whether this is competetive with the "Fortune" or "Smashing" enchantments depends a lot on what other ore processing tools you have available! But, this is a relatively low tech option that can be used quite early game, and as your technology grows, may prove to be even better than those magical methods!
Beyond the normal machines you might recognize, there's also several custom machines purpose made for this pack. A breif description of their functions is provided here:
An ore processing machine that capitalizes on the extreme cold of Cryotheum and and grinds down ores.
An ore processing machine that capitalizes on the extreme heat of Pyrothreum and uses electrical power to blast impurities out of ores.
An ore processing machine that washes the slurry produced in the Immersive Engineering Mixer, so that it can be processed further.
An ore processing machine that capitalizes on the mineral purifying properties of Petrotheum to purify minerals.
An ore processing machine that capitalizes on the extreme pressures of Aerotheum to blast minerals apart into shards for further processing.
A Monstrous device used in the production of Antimatter and Red Matter. Uses extreme energies and exotic materials.
Welcome to the end of the book!

Either you're really dedicated, and paged through the whole thing, or, you tried out the "Previous Page" button on the contents page.

Either way, congratulations on actually clicking on things and reading them! You'll likely go far with those skills in your arsenal! I'm not even being facetious!

Memes aside, thanks for downloading the pack, and trying it out. I hope you manage to have as much fun playing it as I had making it. Don't hesitate to bug me if you have thoughts, feelings, scathing criticism, or whatever.
If you got here from page 1, you can click left 1 more time to see the special thanks pages!

AmazigJJ and Elucent for planting the hipster ideas in my head that eventually became this pack, and helping me put them first into words, and then into a reality.

Skysom, Kindlich, and all the denizens of the Team Acronym and Blame Jared discords, for patiently fielding my questions.

Hubry, for making an entire mod about exploding things, just for me, gosh, I still feel kinda weird about it.

Zoneranger for giving me the best possible silverfish recipe. #FreeZone

Masady, Shadows of Fire, and 
The Icy One for literally adding features to their mods just because 
I offhandedly mentioned them. Heroes we scarcely deserve.

All the nerds at the r/feedthebeast official discord's #packdev channel. You're a buncha sweeties, putting up with my liveblogging.

All the coolcats at the Mod Pack Development Discord. Your knowledge and friendliness helped immensely as the slog of packmaking wore on.

Almost certainly I've forgotten some folks, as this is really the continuation/reimagining of a pack I had started working on in February of 2018. In the intervening months, and in the time before that, I've learned so much from so many people, hopping between discords, asking questions on issue trackers and in reddit threads, it truly would be impossible at this point to tally every crucial contributor, without any of whom, this could not have been realized. 


Thanks to the patience, knowledge, and long suffering of so many members of this community, freely offering knowledge to fill the void of my ignorance, this project was able to go from being a pipe dream to a actual reality.

My best to all of you;

Teeto Kaziim.

Critflaw, Tfarecnim, UVmidnight, Sniper GW, GirlButAlsoAGun(pexium), Norman Normalington, Lumber Wizard, Thanasi's Shadow, Wolferain, ajFish, Dubble, Puppet, Xav101, NimbleNinja, Jojo Reference, Teh Temmie, all of you quite patiently and kindly acted as sounding boards for my wacky ideas, intentionally or otherwise helped inform the hipster-ass opinions I've arrived at, told me when I was being an idiot, and were nice friends to hang out with. Thanks for putting up with me, y'all are neato.

If you're reading this, you either are very thorough, or, mobs are breaking through the walls of your base and vandalizing your storage chests. Luckily, there's some good news in the world, even for one as beleaguered as yourself.

Searching JEI for the tooltip tag "#fortified", will reveal a number of construction materials, some familiar, some new, all of which you will find to be quite sturdy against the attempted intrusions and explosions of enemy forces. The higher the tier of fortification, the harder the material is to break through, for digging mobs, explosions, and even pickaxe armed players. The higher the "fortified" number, the higher the tier.
Aside from arming yourself, a bevy of tools exist for detecting and eliminating encroaching threats, ranging from the mundane to the magitech.
There are a lack of tool-tips for blocks in-world. "The One Probe" is installed, but you will need to craft it in order to use it. It can also be turned into a bauble, or combined with a helmet.

Items are physical objects that take up space. You will not be converting them into data or storing them in a black hole. There are options for storing larger amounts of stuff, but thinking about how you're going to sort and store your wealth is going to be a real problem, that'll require a real solution.

You don't have a psychically powered perfect memory enabling you to remember locations and a topographical map of your world.

There is no minimap. Luckily, there are a number of tools to help you find your way around. Vanilla's maps will fill even when not held in your hand! Bibliocraft's atlas makes managing maps and zoom levels much simpler and more efficient. Compasses galore implore you to magnetically navigate.

Check the #navigation search tag and find your way to success!

Material and Power Logistics Are Bad. 

While there are a number of tools to enable filtering items, getting them from place to place automatically is going to be "involved". Conveyors and Carts are "the meta". We have multiple kinds of hoppers for a reason.

Fluid pipes are dumb, and only move one kind of fluid at a time. Routers can divide out output types from processes that make multiple kinds of liquid.

Power wires have loss over distance. The further you push your power, the less comes out the other side. Different connector types have different transfer limits. Wires will burn if too much power is moved through them. Reference your Immersive Engineering Engineer's Manual for the particulars.
